articles.title: Trump signs executive order on developing artificial intelligence 'free from ideological bias'
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on artificial intelligence Thursday. It revokes past government policies that hinder AI development. The new order also calls for the development of an AI action plan within 180 days. It follows former President Joe Biden's AI executive order of 2023, which Trump rescinded on Monday.

articles.title: Representative Hasenbeck attempts to prohibit revenge porn through AI
articles.author: Reanna Gonzalez
articles.summary: Representative Toni Hasenbeck of Elgin has filed Bill 1364 to prohibit sharing revenge porn created through the use of artificial intelligence. The legislation will be presented for consideration on February 3. Bill 3642, which went into effect on November 1, considers depictions of children engaging in sexually explicit content as child pornography.

articles.title: OpenAI unveils new AI tool ‚ÄòOperator' for independent web tasks
articles.author: HT News Desk
articles.summary: Operator is a new AI tool designed to perform tasks on the web independently. It is currently available to Pro users in the US via operator.chatgpt.com. The company plans to expand access to Plus, Team, and Enterprise users and integrate these features into ChatGPT.

articles.title: AI ‚ÄòWing Girl' Boosts Dates 300% For Awkward Men, Dating Service Says
articles.author: John Koetsier
articles.summary: Ari is an AI-powered dating app designed to help men find dates. It costs $25/month in Canada and $20/month for the U.S. It's available for both iPhone and Android. According to the company, men using the app report a 300% increase in dates within the first month.

articles.title: JetBrains launches Junie, a new AI coding agent for its IDEs
articles.author: Frederic Lardinois
articles.summary: JetBrains launched a new AI coding agent called Junie on Thursday. It works in the IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate and PyCharm Professional IDEs, with WebStorm coming soon. It can solve 53.6% of 500 common developer tasks on a single run. It's available through an early access program behind a waitlist.

articles.title: Trump Calls for US Dominance in AI With New Executive Order
articles.author: Skylar Woodhouse
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday to boost US dominance in artificial intelligence. The order also created a working group to bolster the cryptocurrency industry in the US. The European Union passed the AI Act last year. On his first day in office, Trump unveiled a joint venture on data-center infrastructure with SoftBank Group Corp., OpenAI, and Oracle Corp.

articles.title: Trump Calls for US Dominance in AI With New Executive Order
articles.author: Skylar Woodhouse
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday calling for a new policy on artificial intelligence. The order was one of several signed by Trump on Thursday, including a measure creating a working group to bolster the cryptocurrency industry in the US and exploring the creation of a digital asset stockpile.

articles.title: Bill targets AI-produced pornography deepfakes
articles.author: Steve Metzer
articles.summary: People who use artificial intelligence to produce "deepfake" pornography would be subject to criminal prosecution under House Bill 1364. The bill's author, Rep. Toni Hasenbeck, R-Elgin, is concerned about the growing influence of AI and how it can enable people to use readily available online tools to create porn.

articles.title: OpenAI's latest tool wants to use your computer for you
articles.author: Bemfica de Oliva
articles.summary: OpenAI released a new AI tool called Operator today. Operator is able to perform repetitive online tasks and interact with website interfaces. The tool is currently available to US-based ChatGPT Pro subscribers. It will be available to customers living in other countries in the future.

articles.title: Perplexity's new AI agent can perform multi-step tasks on your Android device
articles.author: Andrew Tarantola
articles.summary: Perplexity is rolling out an agentic AI for Android devices called Perplexity Assistant. It will be able to independently take multi-step actions on behalf of its user. Assistant is free to use as part of the mobile app and will be available in 15 languages.

articles.title: Trump signs AI executive order
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: President Trump signed an executive order on Thursday. It calls for the development of an AI action plan within 180 days. The new order says AI systems should be 'free from ideological bias or engineered social agendas' and that they should be free from 'bias' and 'engineered social agendas.' It also calls for revising or revoking the previous Biden-era AI orders.

articles.title: Fenton police using new AI cameras to help combat crime
articles.author: Zain Omair
articles.summary: The city of Fenton has a new camera system using artificial intelligence (AI) to combat shoplifting and other crime. The police department is partnering with Eagle Eye Networks to install a surveillance camera equipped with AI. The camera is on Leroy Street, a main hub for shopping and business.

It also calls for the development of an AI action plan within 180 days. It follows the repeal of former President Joe Biden's AI executive order of 2023.

articles.summary: Trump took questions from White House reporters on Thursday after signing a series of executive orders and declassifying documents related to the JFK assassination. He was asked about the Stargate project and the $500 billion investment in AI infrastructure announced by OpenAI. Elon Musk tweeted that they don't have the money. Trump replied that he hopes they do, because Elon doesn't like Sam Altman.

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg ‚ÄòLoves' AI-Generated ‚ÄòChallah Horse' On Facebook
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg liked an AI-generated image on Facebook called "Challah Horse" that highlights the amount of AI spam on the social media platform. He liked it because it was created by an AI program called "Meta". It was used by Facebook to spam other people.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Donald Trump signed an executive order related to artificial intelligence on Thursday. The order sets a 180-day deadline for an Artificial Intelligence Action Plan to create a policy to promote human flourishing, economic competitiveness and national security. Trump also wants to remove policies and regulations put in place by former President Joe Biden.

articles.title: Employers Would Rather Hire AI Than Gen Z Graduates: Report
articles.author: Suzanne Blake
articles.summary: Some 37% of employers would rather hire artificial intelligence robots than Gen Z graduates, according to a new survey from Hult International Business School. Gen Z, those born between 1997 and 2012, has been criticized harshly in recent years as they enter the workforce for the first time. The survey interviewed 1,600 employers and full-time employers.

articles.title: What Is the Trump-Backed Stargate AI Project and Why Is It Controversial?
articles.author: Cecelia Smith-Schoenwalder
articles.summary: Trump announced a new project from OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, Oracle and SoftBank dubbed Stargate. Trump called it the 'largest AI infrastructure project, by far, in history' Elon Musk, one of Trump's right-hand men, took to social media to criticize the project.

articles.title: Operator: OpenAI's Next Step Toward the ‚ÄòAgentic' Future
articles.author: Megan Crouse
articles.summary: Operator is an agentic AI tool developed by OpenAI. It runs on the same technology as ChatGPT but within a proprietary web browser. It can perform actions autonomously such as ordering groceries or booking tours. OpenAI collaborated with DoorDash, Instacart, OpenTable, Priceline, StubHub, Thumbtack, and Uber to develop Operator.

articles.title: Is ChatGPT down? Tens of thousands report issues with A.I. chatbot
articles.author: Mark Colley
articles.summary: ChatGPT, the artificial intelligence chatbot run by OpenAI, went down Thursday morning for tens of thousands of users across the world. On downdetector.ca, 492 Canadian users reported issues with OpenAI at 6:49 a.m. ET. In the U.S., more than 4,000 users said the platform was down, while another 5,600 reported issues in the UK. articles.author: Spooky
articles.summary: Chinese startup Engine AI recently launched a new humanoid robot called SE01. It is powered by dual processors from Nvidia and Intel and features three stereo cameras that help it navigate and interact with complex environments. Dr. Jim Fan, who leads Nvidia's GR00T project, posted a video of SE01 walking in Shenzen, near Engine AI's headquarters, asking people to confirm that it was a real robot.

articles.summary: OpenAI unveiled Operator, its first AI agent, for ChatGPT Pro subscribers in the US. It can autonomously complete tasks like booking reservations or buying groceries. The agent is powered by a new model built in GPT-4o called CUA. It's trained to use and control a computer in the same way that humans can.

The company will be managed by OpenAI, Softbank, Oracle, Microsoft, NVIDIA, and MGX. The buildout is currently underway in Texas, and they are evaluating potential sites across the country. The Pentagon is looking at smaller nuclear power plants to provide one to five megawatts of power in a compact, long-distance package.

articles.title: Intuitive Announces Fourth Quarter Earnings
articles.author: Intuitive Surgical
articles.summary: Intuitive announces financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2024. Intuitive is a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and the pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. Q4 Highlights include the Company's financial results from the previous quarter.

OpenAI is collaborating with DoorDash, Instacart, OpenTable, Priceline, StubHub, Thumbtack, and Uber to improve Operator's functionalities.

articles.title: Trump Signs Executive Actions Related to Cryptocurrency, AI
articles.author: Stephanie Lai
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed executive actions related to cryptocurrency and artificial intelligence. The crypto order creates a working group to advise the White House on digital asset policies. The group will be tasked with submitting a report to the president within six months recommending a regulatory framework and legislative proposals. Trump's order is a step toward fulfilling his campaign promises to be an advocate for the burgeoning crypto industry.

articles.title: 2025 is the year of AI agents, OpenAI CPO says
articles.author: Emily Hamilton
articles.summary: AI agents have gained traction in recent months as the next big thing in the workplace. OpenAI's Kevin Weil thinks 2025 is the year that ChatGPT will do things in the real world for you. AI is changing the skills needed to excel in today's jobs. Qualcomm's Don McGuire talks about the privacy benefits of on-premise AI.

articles.title: Capcom testing generative AI to manage 'tens of thousands of ideas'
articles.summary: Capcom's next big release, Monster Hunter Wilds, is coming to store shelves at the end of February. The developer has also announced new games in both the Okami and Onimusha series as well. Capcom is using a Gemini AI model fed all sorts of details and information about the game to generate ideas that are internally consistent.

articles.title: Anthropic's new Citations feature aims to reduce AI errors
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: Anthropic on Thursday unveiled Citations, a new feature for its developer API that allows AI models to provide detailed references to "the exact sentences and passages" from documents they use to generate responses. Citations is available in both Anthropic's API and Google's Vertex AI platform. It's free for Claude 3.5 Sonnet and Haiku models, but may incur charges depending on length and number of source documents.

articles.title: The AI Revolution
articles.author: Jake Dabkowski
articles.summary: Shelfmark provides businesses with artificial intelligence-powered cameras for inventory monitoring in Pittsburgh. Shelfmark is one of hundreds of startups in the area working with AI. Pittsburgh ranked 10th in the nation for the total venture deals per capita in AI, autonomous vehicles and machine learning, and 21st for overall venture deals. Carnegie Mellon University is consistently ranked as a top AI school in the world. The metro boasts the third-highest pay for AI software engineers in the U.S., being beat out only by the San Francisco Bay Area and Seattle.

articles.title: A.I. Pioneer Yoshua Bengio Warns About A.I. Models' ‚ÄòSelf-Preserving' Ability
articles.author: Alexandra Tremayne-Pengelly
articles.summary: Yoshua Bengio is the scientific director of the Quebec's Mila A.I. Institute and a professor at the University of Montreal. Last month, OpenAI and Apollo Research released a study showing that A.Is can engage in self-preserving actions. Bengio has publicly warned that the unintended consequences of this development could include turning against humans and advocated a slowdown in progress.

articles.title: Why the US Navy wants to build a fully autonomous satellite
articles.author: Courtney Albon
articles.summary: Navy researchers are testing a fully autonomous satellite designed to detect and characterize objects in space. The system, called Autosat, is designed to task, calibrate its signals and send and receive information on its own without the need for a human operator. Steven Meier, director of space technology at the Naval Research Laboratory, said Thursday his team has demonstrated the capability in the lab.

articles.title: Oklahoma Lawmaker Introduces Bill to Combat AI-Generated Revenge
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Rep. Toni Hasenbeck, a Republican from Elgin, has introduced a bill to deter the creation and distribution of AI-generated revenge pornography in Oklahoma. The bill would fold sexual content manufactured through AI into existing statutes that prohibit revenge pornography. The representative warned against the dual-edged nature of technology and stressed the need for the law to keep up.

articles.title: Amanda Knox must serve three years in prison for defamation
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Generative AI writers are helping people create engaging content using machine learning algorithms. Amanda Knox was wrongfully convicted and acquitted of the murder of Meredith Kercher in 2007. She was exonerated from the murder charges in 2015, but she is still serving a three-year sentence for defamation.

articles.title: OpenAI unveils tool to automate web tasks as AI agents take center-stage

The tool, called Operator, is powered by a model that allows it to interact with on-screen buttons, menus and text fields. Perplexity launched an agent-based assistant for Android devices earlier on Thursday.

articles.title: OpenAI's agent that can do work for you is here

It can do tasks such as completing online forms and grocery shopping. It is powered by a new OpenAI model called Operator. The startup plans to roll the AI agent out to other chatGPT users and integrate Operator's capabilities into the chatbot.

articles.summary: Perplexity has developed a mobile assistant for Android. It can answer general questions and perform tasks on your behalf. It's also multimodal, so you can ask it questions about what's on your screen and have it open your camera and see what's in front of you. Perplexity's assistant supports Spotify, YouTube, Uber, email, messaging, and clock apps.

articles.title: Ancient civilization unearthed by groundbreaking AI technology in Dubai desert
articles.author: Mataeo Smith
articles.summary: This week archeologists uncovered a 5,000-year-old ancient civilization in the Dubai desert using a combination of artificial intelligence and advanced imaging technology. This innovative approach is transforming the field of archaeology, allowing researchers to uncover hidden sites without the need for excavation, which is often the most challenging part of the job.

It is powered by a new model built in GPT-4o called CUA. Operator scored 38.1% compared to 72.4% for humans in benchmarking.

articles.title: Trump AI project reignites feud between Musk, OpenAI chief
articles.author: Miranda Nazzaro
articles.summary: Elon Musk and Sam Altman are at odds over the new artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure project, Stargate, which is being funded in part by Altman's company. Musk claims the project does not have the $500 billion promised by President Trump. Altman is a longtime Democratic donor but donated $1 million to Trump's inaugural fund.

articles.title: London cabbies' planning strategies could help inform future of AI
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of York, University College London and Champalimaud Foundation studied the thinking time of London taxi drivers as part of a study into the future of AI route-mapping. They found that taxi drivers use their cognitive resources in a much more efficient way than current technology.

articles.title: Georgia lawmakers seek to criminalize AI-generated sexually explicit images of children
articles.author: Caleb Groves
articles.summary: Georgia lawmakers are seeking to criminalize the distribution of AI-generated child sexual abuse and shore up gaps in state law. The bill, sponsored by state Sen. John Albers, R-Roswell, would punish anyone found in possession or distributing the deepfakes with up to 15 years in prison. California passed a similar measure last year.

articles.title: Fortinet, Inc. (FTNT) Sees Price Target Boost to $115 Amid Rising Demand for AI-Powered Cybersecurity Solutions

articles.summary: Doug Collins, a former congressman from Georgia, is a nominee to be the next VA secretary. Sen. Bill Cassidy wants to know if Doug Collins will use artificial intelligence to solve the massive backlog of people applying for VA disability benefits. The department started using AI to tackle its claims backlog at least five years ago. Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has made a lot of money from his anti-vaccine legal and advocacy work.

articles.title: Trump must take proactive approach to AI and jobs
articles.author: Robert Cropf
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is disrupting America's job market. The Trump administration should craft a comprehensive plan to tackle AI-driven job losses. The administration should establish partnerships to provide subsidized retraining programs in high-demand fields like cybersecurity, health care, and renewable energy. Community technology centers and libraries equipped with online courses could be deployed in rural and underserved areas. Establishing "economic diversification zones" would attract growth-oriented industries such as advanced manufacturing, green energy, and technology startups.

It has been integrated into iOS as part of the Apple Intelligence feature. Dr. Anya Sharma is a renowned AI researcher and author of the book 'The Algorithmic Age'.

articles.author: John A. Tures

articles.title: Uber Technologies, Inc. (UBER): Must-Watch High-Flying AI Stock This Week
articles.author: Abdul Rahman
articles.summary: The US equity market is the most expensive it has ever been. Most counters are trading at all-time highs. Morgan Stanley's head of research, Katy Hubert, believes the AI-driven bull market is just getting started. Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:UBER) ranks 1st on our list of high-flying AI stocks this week. Goldman Sachs upgraded Uber to Buy on January 15 with a $141 price target.

articles.title: Adobe Inc. (ADBE): Must-Watch High-Flying AI Stock This Week

articles.summary: Adobe Inc. (NASDAQ:ADBE) is a diversified software company that offers products, services, and solutions that enable individuals, teams, and enterprises to create, publish, and promote content. BNP Paribas upgraded the stock on January 15 to Neutral from Underperforming.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces Operator to automate tasks like vacation planning, restaurant reservations

It competes with earlier release from Anthropic, the Amazon-backed AI startup behind the Claude chatbot. Anthropic is in talks to raise a funding round of $2 billion at a $60 billion valuation.

articles.title: What If Humans Don't Outperform AI In ‚ÄòHuman Skills'?
articles.author: Michael B. Horn
articles.summary: As AI improves, it will commoditize technical skills and accentuate the things that make us human, like empathy and connection with other human beings or our ability to communicate. At the surface level, AI chatbots are good at listening, but are they as good as the master listeners among us?

articles.title: Revolutionizing Online Casinos with AI-Powered Learning!
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence transforms the way players interact with online casinos. It personalizes gaming experiences, making each session unique and captivating for users. It helps casinos stand out in a crowded market and provides a competitive edge. It also improves security and promotes responsible gaming practices.

articles.title: People overestimate reliability of AI-assisted language tools: Adding uncertainty phrasing can help
articles.author: University
articles.summary: People generally overestimate the accuracy of large language model (LLM) outputs, according to a new study by cognitive and computer scientists at the University of California, Irvine. However, with some tweaks, these tools can be trained to provide explanations that enable users to gauge uncertainty and better distinguish fact from fiction.

articles.title: Perplexity debuts AI assistant on Android to challenge Alexa, ChatGPT
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Perplexity launched an agent-based assistant for Android devices on Thursday. The tool can book dinner reservations, hail rides and set reminders. It is available in 15 languages on Google's Play Store. Perplexity would like to make it available on iOS, if Apple gives them permission.

articles.title: Pipeshift cuts GPU usage for AI inferences 75% with modular interface engine
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Pipeshift has a Lego-like system that allows teams to configure the right inference stack for their AI workloads without extensive engineering. The system is available in a free trial version.    for AI teams. It's available in English and in German.

articles.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Gemini New Bixby AI Feature
articles.author: Janhoi McGregor
articles.summary: Janhoi McGregor reviews Samsung's new Galaxy S25 Ultra. Samsung's in-house AI, Bixby, has been repurposed for navigating through Samsung phones. Samsung executives claim that any and all settings can be changed with a spoken request from the user.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces Operator to automate tasks such as vacation planning, restaurant reservations
articles.author: Hayden Field Cnbc
articles.summary: Operator is an artificial intelligence chatbot developed by OpenAI. It can perform tasks such as planning vacations, filling out forms, making restaurant reservations and ordering groceries. It competes with an earlier release from Anthropic, the Amazon-backed artificial intelligence startup behind Claude chatbot.

articles.title: OpenAI introduces Operator to automate tasks like vacation planning, restaurant reservations
articles.author: Hayden Field Cnbc
articles.summary: Operator is an artificial intelligence chatbot developed by OpenAI. It can perform tasks like planning vacations, filling out forms, making restaurant reservations and ordering groceries. It competes with Anthropic, the Amazon-backed AI startup behind the Claude chatbot. Anthropic is in talks to raise a funding round of $2 billion at a $60 billion valuation.

articles.title: Analyzing AI's linguistic capabilities: New methods offer fresh insights
articles.author: Johanna Hillgren
articles.summary: A new doctoral thesis from the University of Gothenburg offers insights into the ongoing debate about AI, its capabilities, and its future development. The development of analytical methods is essential to measure and understand the linguistic capabilities of large language models. The thesis also has the potential to provide new insights into linguistics.

articles.title: OpenAI Releases AI Agent That Helps Book Flights, Order Food for Users
articles.author: Rachel Metz
articles.summary: Operator is an artificial intelligence tool that can help book flights, plan grocery orders and even complete purchases for users. It's available to US customers who pay $200 per month for the ChatGPT Pro subscription. Operator's software works by combining some of OpenAI's computer-vision features with multi-step problem-solving capabilities.

articles.title: OpenAI launches Operator‚Äîan agent that can use a computer for you
articles.author: Will Douglas Heaven
articles.summary: Operator is a web app that can carry out simple online tasks in a browser. It is powered by a new model called Computer-Using Agent (CUA) built on top of OpenAI's multimodal large language model GPT-4o. The app is available today at operator.chatgpt.com to anyone signed up with ChatGPT Pro. OpenAI claims it outperforms similar rival tools, including Anthropic's Computer Use and Google DeepMind's Mariner.

articles.title: OpenAI Unveils A.I. Agent That Can Use Websites on Its Own
articles.author: Cade Metz
articles.summary: OpenAI launched the chatbot craze with the release of ChatGPT two years ago. On Thursday, OpenAI unveiled a tool called Operator that can go out onto the internet and perform tasks autonomously, like shopping for groceries or booking a restaurant reservation. Operator is based on the same technology that underpins Chat GPT. The New York Times has sued OpenAI and its partner, Microsoft, for copyright infringement of news content related to A.I. systems.

articles.title: OpenAI launches Operator, an AI agent that performs tasks autonomously
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.summary: Operator is a general-purpose AI agent that can take control of a web browser and independently perform certain actions. It's available to U.S. users on ChatGPT's $200 Pro subscription plan first. OpenAI plans to roll it out to more users in its Plus, Team, and Enterprise tiers eventually. Operator is powered by a computer-using agent, or CUA, that combines the vision capabilities of the company's GPT-4o model with the reasoning abilities from OpenAI's more advanced models.

articles.title: OpenAI's ‚ÄòOperator' Agent Can Buy Groceries, File Expense Reports
articles.author: Belle Lin
articles.summary: Operator is an artificial intelligence agent developed by OpenAI. It works by accessing the internet through its own browser and can click, scroll and type just as a person would. It's available to ChatGPT Pro users in the United States for $200 a month. OpenAI is also working with Instacart, Uber, eBay, Priceline, OpenTable and Etsy to make their webpages more accessible on the Operator home page.

articles.title: OpenAI's new Operator AI agent can do things on the web for you
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: OpenAI is releasing a'research preview' of an AI agent called Operator that can go to the web to perform tasks for you. It's launching first in the US for subscribers of OpenAI's $200 per month ChatGPT Pro tier. Operator uses a model that combines GPT-4o's vision capabilities with 'advanced reasoning through reinforcement learning' to interact with GUIs.

articles.title: California is investigating OpenAI's conversion to a for-profit company
articles.author: Khari Johnson
articles.summary: The California attorney general's office is investigating OpenAI. It wants to know if OpenAI plans to convert to a for-profit corporation and transfer assets out of its existing nonprofit. OpenAI has not commented on the investigation yet.   ¬†

articles.title: OpenAI's new Operator will do web tasks for you
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: OpenAI has released a "research preview" of an AI agent called Operator that performs web-based tasks on behalf of users. 2025 is shaping up to be the year of the AI agent. Operator is available only to OpenAI's $200/month Pro subscribers.

articles.title: Capcom Has Been on a Hot Streak, but Their Generative AI Plans May Quickly Extinguish That
articles.author: Shaun Cichacki
articles.summary: Capcom is considering using Generative AI in upcoming games. Kazuki Abe mentioned in an interview that one of the most difficult parts of creating new games is coming up with 'hundreds of thousands of unique ideas' for environmental details. EA Sports College Football 25 used the technology to help create character likenesses.

articles.title: Law School Now Requires Students To Get Artificial Intelligence Certification
articles.author: Joe Patrice
articles.summary: Case Western Reserve University School of Law will require all first-year law students to earn a certification in legal artificial intelligence (AI) for the Introduction to AI and the Law program. It is the first law school in the U.S. to require legal AI education certification for law students.

articles.title: Developer Creates Infinite Maze That Traps AI Training Bots
articles.author: Jason Koebler
articles.summary: A pseudonymous coder created and released an open source 'tar pit' to indefinitely trap AI training web crawlers in an infinitely, randomly-generating series of pages to waste their time and computing power. The program is called Nepenthes after the genus of carnivorous pitcher plants which trap and consume their prey. It can be deployed by webpage owners to protect their content from being scraped or as a honeypot trap to waste AI companies' resources.

articles.title: Thread by @aravindputrevu on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Trump announced Project Stargate 3 days ago. It's a $500 billion bet to dominate the global AI race. The goal is to build massive AI data centers across the U.S., starting in Texas. The project is expected to create 100,000+ jobs and re-industrialize America.

articles.title: Inside Stargate's AI Reality Distortion Field
articles.author: R. Scott Raynovich
articles.summary: Stargate Project is a proposed $500 million investment in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the U.S. by Softbank, OpenAI, Oracle, and UAE investment firm MGX. The project will employ over 100,000 Americans. SoftBank has secured $30 billion in capital for the project. Microsoft has only allocated $80 billion to AI investment this year. Tesla and xAI Founder Elon Musk claims SoftBank doesn't have the money.

articles.title: Perplexity launches an assistant for Android
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Perplexity has launched an AI-powered assistant called Perplexity Assistant for Android devices. It uses reasoning, search, and apps to help with daily tasks. It's available in 15 languages and is free for Android users in English, Spanish, French, German, Japanese, Korean, and Hindi. Some of the actions might not always work.

articles.title: Trump spokesperson pushes back on Musk Stargate criticism: ‚ÄòThose investments are coming'
articles.author: Julia Shapero

It aims to invest up to $500 billion in AI infrastructure over the next four years, with OpenAI, Softbank and Oracle as initial equity investors. Elon Musk, a close ally of Trump and a rival of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, cast doubt on the project's funding. Steve Bannon, who has been at odds with Musk in recent weeks, also slammed the tech mogul.

articles.title: Texas May Change Rules For Health Insurance Companies

The proposed law would prohibit health insurance companies from using AI technology as 'the sole basis' to determine medical necessity on behalf of patients. It would also give the Texas Department of Insurance the authority to inspect a health insurance company's use of AI.

articles.title: A new AI benchmark called 'Humanity's Last Exam' stumped top models ‚Äî for now, at least
articles.author: Britney Nguyen
articles.summary: According to a new benchmark called 'Humanity's Last Exam' (HLE), top AI models from OpenAI, Google and Anthropic aren't quite 'at the frontier of human knowledge' yet. The evaluation was developed by researchers at the Center for AI Safety (CAIS) and Scale AI.

articles.title: Texas May Change Rules For Health Insurance Companies
articles.author: Jasmine Laws
articles.summary: Texas Senator Charles Schwertner wants to tighten controls on health insurance companies using artificial intelligence (AI) to handle patient claims. California, Georgia, New York and Pennsylvania have already implemented greater controls on the use of AI in health insurance providers' handling of patient claims, while at least 40 states have introduced legislation on AI regulation in 2024.

articles.title: President Trump Says It's Time For DEI To Die
articles.author: James Laverty
articles.summary: Greg comments on President Trump's orders to eliminate DEI programs. Greg pokes fun at Jesse Watters after a new A.I. technology claims it can predict career success with facial recognition technology.Learn more about your ad choices at podcastchoices.com.

articles.title: Ways of Seeing: AI bot proved not up to the task
articles.author: Megan James
articles.summary: Alice Leeds' sister visited her this fall. Alice and her sister enjoyed their visit. Alice's sister ate from Alice's garden's harvest and Alice enjoyed walking in Lincoln and Bristol. Alice is glad you're interested in this valuable content. For full access to this story and all online content, please log in or subscribe to the Addison Independent.

articles.title: Why the Battle Against Cancer Needs Awesome Video Games (University of California, Merced)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Yoshimi discusses the "meta-game" - the process of creating a suite of powerful, irresistible games. He details everything they need: crack programmers, visionary leaders and deep-pocketed financiers, as well as reward. They want to have human-AI symbiosis.

articles.title: Why professionals still don't trust AI and AI agents despite growing adoption

Most workers are interested in using AI agents at work, but some are sceptical about their reliability and quality. articles.title: Dentist Slammed for Using ChatGPT to 'Prove' Cancer Patient Wrong

articles.summary: Reddit post about ChatGPT being used by a dentist to prove a point against a cancer patient about brushing and flossing during a dental cleaning went viral. Rachel Rawson, the lead cancer nurse at Perci Health, a virtual care clinic in the U.K., said it's important to follow the advice of your doctor or nurse.

articles.title: Nevisense (EIS) included in updated German (S1) imaging guidelines

Nevisense (EIS) is mentioned as a technology for detecting Melanoma and Non-Melanoma skin cancer as well as the future potential in Atopic Dermatitis (AD). The guidelines focus on the high sensitivity and the ability to decrease the number of excisions needed to find a melanoma.

articles.title: Incorporating AI Agents Into Your Workforce: 5 Future Of Work Ideas
articles.author: Chris Westfall
articles.summary: As AI agents become more prevalent, businesses must rethink workforce dynamics to unlock their full potential. Business leaders should treat AI agents as teammates, not infallible authorities. They should train their team to think of prompts as conversations with a highly skilled teammate and to focus on creativity and innovation.

articles.title: Embodied AI reveals how robots and toddlers learn to understand
articles.author: Adrian Skov
articles.summary: Researchers from Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology have created an embodied intelligence model with a novel architecture that allows access to the various internal states of the neural network. The model is based on a PV-RNN (Predictive coding inspired, Variational Recurrent Neural Network) framework, trained through embodied interactions integrating three simultaneous inputs related to different senses: vision, with a video of a robot arm moving colored blocks, proprioception, with the joint angles of the robot arm as it moves, and a language instruction like "put red on blue".

articles.title: Why is ChatGPT down for millions? OpenAI responds to downtime
articles.summary: ChatGPT is experiencing a global outage, leaving users unable to access the service via the web or app. Downdetector has received over a thousand reports from users about the service not working properly. articles.title: The 6 Best Resume Builders‚ÄîWe Weighed The Pros And Cons
articles.author: Alexandra Garrett
articles.summary: Kickresume is the best resume builder according to Forbes. Zety breaks down resume writing into easy-to-follow steps and Resume Now helps you create professional documents in just 15 minutes. Resume.com lets you create multiple resumes, edit them and download them free of charge.

articles.title: UiPath CEO Daniel Dines discusses the future of work with agentic automation

articles.title: Vanilla Launches V/AI Copilot, an Estate Planning Assistant for Advisors
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: V/AI Copilot is an AI-driven assistant that transforms how financial advisors approach estate planning. It is designed to simplify complex tasks, streamline workflows and help advisors build stronger client relationships. It's the brainchild of Vanilla, the leader in estate planning software.

articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: ethical consideration for CEOs is whether to allow an AI tool to "speak for you"   for you.    in AI tool  for CEOs  for CEO  for AI tool.  for them  for the CEO   to speak for you

articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Insurity's 2025 AI in Insurance Report highlights key insights on consumer confidence in AI for assessing and processing claims after severe weather events. articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Plan Discussed For Cheltenham Schools
articles.author: Dino Ciliberti
articles.summary: Cheltenham Township School District's comprehensive plan is due on March 31. Four priorities were identified: reorganization of student transitions, reinforcing attendance practices, increasing student engagement, and ensuring standards-aligned curriculum K-12. articles.title: AI Hype Is Dropping Off a Cliff While Costs Soar, Experts Warn
articles.summary: IT spending on AI is expected to reach $5.5 trillion in 2025, up 9.8 percent from 2024. Data centers, devices, and software will see double-digit growth in 2025. However, these segments are not ready to "differentiate themselves in terms of functionality" yet.

articles.title: ChatGPT suffered a major outage this morning, but OpenAI says it's back up
articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.summary: ChatGPT, OpenAI's AI chatbot platform, suffered a major outage Thursday morning. OpenAI has implemented a fix and is "monitoring the results." This reporter was able to log into ChatGPT on the web as of publish time. In December, the company's other AI tools experienced a similar outage and it took three hours to restore service.

articles.summary: ChatGPT, the world's best-known artificial intelligence tool, was temporarily down Thursday morning. Thousands of users around the world reported issues. The company identified the root cause of the issue and implemented a fix shortly after 10 a.m. Eastern.

articles.author: Tech Desk

articles.author: Laurel Stone
articles.summary: ChatGPT experienced an outage early Thursday. The software developer, OpenAI, identified the root of the problem and fixed it before 8 a.m. The company did not provide a reason for the outage. About 300 million people use ChatGPT each week.

articles.title: Can The UK ai Action Plan Turn The Economy Around?
articles.author: Mike O'Sullivan

One of them is the use of AI assistants to speed up public services, with data-sharing deals across siloed departments, and a new set of AI tools dubbed 'Humphrey' after a TV political sitcom called 'Yes, Prime Minister'. The government also wants to make high value datasets available to AI researchers and push ahead with AI-specific regulations for frontier AI models.

articles.title: Last week, OpenAI shocked the tech world by announcing a breakthrough in soft AGI (Artificial General Intelligence)‚Äîthe holy grail of AI development

articles.summary: Last week, OpenAI announced a breakthrough in soft AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) which is the holy grail of AI development. AGI isn't just smarter than humans, it can invent, innovate and build better AI systems, creating a recursive feedback loop.

articles.title: Samsung unpacks Galaxy AI's personal data engine
articles.author: Computer Weekly
articles.summary: Galaxy Unpacked event has shown how the tech giant wants everyone to interact with artificial intelligence (AI). The mobile phone manufacturer used the event to unveil how millions have used Galaxy AI to experience deeper, more meaningful connections. This includes breaking down language barriers in real time.

articles.summary: Students at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign showed how artificial intelligence could impact boats on the water at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas earlier this month. articles.title: Smith: Artificial Intelligence: An Existential Threat to Humanity
articles.author: The Publisher
articles.summary: The first Stargate data centers are already under construction in Texas. Trump claims the initial startup project will create 100,000 jobs across America. Microsoft and OpenAI are collaborating on an AI supercomputer called Stargate estimated to cost $100 billion. Big Tech is never interested in preserving what has been and promotes a new world order.

articles.title: Coval evaluates AI voice and chat agents like self-driving cars
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Brooke Hopkins, a former tech lead at Waymo, is launching Coval, a platform that builds simulations for AI voice and chat agents. Coval's tech evaluates the agents on a general set of metrics, but companies can also customize what they are looking for and use Coval to continue to evaluate for regressions.

articles.author: Brian Sozzi
articles.summary: HPE CEO Antonio Neri is at the World Economic Forum this week. He believes AI is not out of control, but it needs to be properly regulated. HPE shares are up 14% so far this year, while the Nasdaq Composite is up 2%.

articles.title: AI Firm Palona Snags $10M Seed Funding, Taking on Amazon, UberEats with Human-like Agents
articles.author: Trishla Ostwal
articles.summary: Palona AI has secured $10 million in seed funding. The startup is developing high-EQ AI agents that interact directly with customers. Palona's technology is multi-modal, supporting voice, text, image, and video-based interactions. It integrates across a variety of channels, like web widgets, iOS and Android apps and WhatsApp for Business.

articles.title: ChatGPT experiences major outage affecting thousands
articles.author: Sydney Hartman
articles.summary: ChatGPT, an artificial intelligence chatbot launched by OpenAI, suffered an outage on Thursday. More than 4,000 users reported an outage starting at about 6 a.m., according to DownDetector. Most of the reported issues were with ChatGPT.

articles.title: ChatGPT experiences major outage affecting thousands
articles.author: Sydney Hartman
articles.summary: ChatGPT, an artificial intelligence chatbot launched by OpenAI, suffered an outage on Thursday. More than 4,000 users reported an outage starting at about 6 a.m. Most of the reported issues were with ChatGPT. The cause of the outage is unknown.

articles.title: OpenAI services are down, including ChatGPT
articles.author: Dominic Genetti
articles.summary: The ChatGPT software developed by OpenAI is down for many users. The outage began at 6 a.m. ET. The problem has been identified and the company is working on a fix for the issue.   The number of reports has decreased to 1,300 as of 8:30 am ET, but the outage continues.

articles.title: OpenAI services are down, including ChatGPT
articles.author: Dominic Genetti

articles.title: OpenAI resolves outage affecting ChatGPT and other tools

According to DownDetector.com reports of an OpenAI outage began at about 6 a.m. ET with more than 4,000 people reporting the issue.

articles.title: Why Is Palo Alto Networks Inc. (PANW) Among The Analyst Favorites This Week?
articles.author: Jabran Kundi
articles.summary: US stocks registered a green day on Tuesday with the Dow surging up 538 points to end 1.24%. S&P 500 and Nasdaq also posted gains of 0.88% and 0.64%. Palo Alto Networks Inc. (NASDAQ:PANW) is a global cybersecurity solutions provider. Morgan Stanley upgraded PANW's target price from $223 to $230. PANW ranks 5th on the list of the stocks that became analyst favorites this week.

articles.title: MIT Technology Review unveils the full agenda for EmTech AI, the longest-running AI business conference, set for May 5-7, 2025
articles.author: MIT Technology Review
articles.summary: EmTech AI 2025 is a three-day event hosted by MIT Technology Review. The agenda includes visionary speakers, breakthrough sessions, cutting-edge research, and the critical strategies and topics driving the future of AI in business and society. It's designed for the emerging and established executives making critical AI strategy decisions.

articles.title: ChatGPT down as users report outages on AI chatbot as 'fix' promise made
articles.author: John O'sullivan

GhostGPT can be used within Telegram, so no suspicious software needs to be downloaded onto the user's device. Private GPT models for nefarious use have been emerging for some time.

articles.title: Dell Technologies BrandVoice: The Edge Of AI: Predictions For 2025

articles.summary: 2024 was an AI whirlwind, with the proliferation of GenAI dominating headlines. John Roese predicts agentic AI will be the word of the year in 2025. On Thursday morning, when visiting its website, the message "bad gateway" popped up.
